issue.title: How to run gazebo integrated unit test

content.raw:
Thanks for tracking the problem. The explanation is easy, a good solution is difficult: the metadata for generating the debians in our building farm is totally isolated from the metadata used in debian for packaging (propagated to Ubuntu afterwards). Easy to see: this is the [file used to to declare files in -dev in our repository](#!/osrf/gazebo7-release/src/23684d0dd6738202c21e71fa5aa78100a5f93d2f/ubuntu/debian/libgazebo-dev.install?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) and [this is the file for the same goal in debian](https://anonscm.debian.org/cgit/debian-science/packages/gazebo.git/tree/debian/libgazebo7-dev.install). There is one line difference: yes, the `usr/lib/*/*.a`.

I think that we are good for trying to propose a Stable Release Update so we get the fix into Ubuntu Xenial. I need to check what is the proper for Debian Jessie, I will also do that.

Sorry for the inconvenience, the workaround is to install the `packages.osrfoundation.org` repository and get the most updated gazebo7 from there.

The explanation is easy, a good solution is difficult: the metadata for generating the debians in our building farm is totally isolated from the metadata used in debian for packaging (propagated to Ubuntu afterwards). Easy to see: this is the file used to to declare files in -dev in our repository and this is the file for the same goal in debian. There is one line difference: yes, the usr/lib/*/*.a.

I think that we are good for trying to propose a Stable Release Update so we get the fix into Ubuntu Xenial. I need to check what is the proper for Debian Jessie, I will also do that.

Sorry for the inconvenience, the workaround is to install the packages.osrfoundation.org repository and get the most updated gazebo7 from there.
